results.title: Sales Executive - Salesforce Services
results.description:
OVERVIEW

As a result of continued growth, we are looking for a passionate, ambitious, and experienced Salesforce Channel Manager to manage our prospecting and sales activities with Salesforce prospects and clients in the Energy, Automotive, and Transportation Sectors. As a Salesforce implementation partner, a large portion of our business is derived from recommendations and referrals from Salesforce Account Executives and other roles inside of Salesforce. We are looking for a person with excellent communication, listening, and interpersonal skills that has a good understanding of the Salesforce product ecosystem and has familiarity with the manufacturing industry. We are effectively looking for someone that speaks both Salesforce and Energy, Automotive, and Transportation and has Consulting Services experience, and can work to build trust and relationships with Salesforce account executives and other Salesforce roles, prospects, and clients. 

What you will do...

  • Work with other Tectonic Sales leadership to develop a strategy to connect with Salesforce Account Executives (“AE”).
  • Identify target Salesforce AEs with energy, automotive, and transportation accounts or prospects. 
  • Present and communicate Tectonic Solutions’ value-added capabilities to Salesforce AEs, highlighting Tectonics' capabilities in the energy, automotive, and transportation industries. 
  • Build trust through assisting Salesforce AEs and using industry knowledge and knowledge of Salesforce products. 
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with AEs.
  • Identify opportunities to work with Salesforce AEs on specific prospects or clients. 
  • Collaborate with Tectonic solutioning and delivery resources to ensure a well-aligned solution for prospective customers.
  • Maintain and update our Salesforce CRM system with prospect/customer information.

Additional Responsibilities:

  • The most important part of this job is to build trust with Salesforce AEs to get the opportunities that come with new Salesforce Licensing.
  • Participate in marketing and networking events such as seminars, trade shows, and sales meetings.
  • Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to the Salesforce Energy, Automotive, and Transportation Sectors and the Salesforce AEs that you are working with.
  • Proactively identify, escalate and participate in resolving Salesforce AEs and the joint prospect concerns or issues

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of sales and/or account management experience in the Energy, Automotive, and Transportation Sectors
  • Salesforce Sales or Service product knowledge and experience
  • Experience selling professional services
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate, earn trust, and effectively present at executive and C-level
  • Excellent listening and negotiating abilitiesProven ability to manage multiple opportunities at a time while paying strict attention to detail

Desired Experience:

  • Have an understanding of the target audience, including industry knowledge and key business issues Salesforce solutions can address, industry trends, and competition
  • Existing relationships with Salesforce Energy, Automotive, and Transportation SectorsAEs
  • Experience with selling or delivering Salesforce products
  • Certification(s) in any Salesforce product
  • Working with global(offshore) delivery teams

results.title: Head of Real Estate Sales
results.description:
Description

This is a remote position.

About Us
 
Sell2Rent is seeking a Head of Real Estate sales to join our remote team and be responsible for coordinating the sales team.
 
Sell2Rent is revolutionizing Real Estate by creating a platform that empowers homeowners to sell their homes (and stay in them as renters) to investors who want to acquire those properties. S2R will bring to mainstream America what corporate America has had for decades: Lease-Backs. We will allow homeowners to unlock equity from their most significant asset, their home while allowing them to stay as renters. Sell2Rent is a technology-first company that sees a giant opportunity in the single-family home market. Starting in the US and then globally. Every year over six million homes are sold in the US alone. How many can be sold when owners realize they can sell, cash out and stay in the homes they love?
 
About The Position
 
The Head of Sales is responsible for managing and overseeing the sales operations. she/he should have between 8+ years of experience with Real Estate Sales, designing plans to meet targets, developing relationships with clients/customers, training and onboarding the sales team.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
  • Oversee the sales agent team and handle any issues that arise, as well as make sure sales goals are met
  • Conduct final interviews for the real estate sales staff.
  • Develop and implement training programs that teach sales agents how to get customers, negotiate real estate deals, acquire financing, and appropriately fill out sale paperwork
  • Plan and implement sales objectives and evaluate sales performance to ensure goal accomplishment
 

 

Requirements

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent

  • 8+ Years of experience in real estate sales

    • Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close

  • Experience with Real Estate Wholesaling

  • Experience with Real Estate Brokerage

  • Experience training sales teams, developing playbooks and best practices

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (C1+)

  • Knowledge of ZOHO CRM is a plus

 

 

Benefits
 
  • Long-term opportunity.
  • Flexible schedule.
  • 100% Remote.
  • Start-up work environment.
  • Career Growth: build experience with sophisticated business applications.
Sell2Rent is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

 

Skills

Qualifications Bachelor’s degree economics, finance, international business and background in analytics 5+ years of relevant work experience Experience working in a customer relationship management platform (CRM - Zoho CRM is a plus) Knowledge of real estate is a plus Required english proficiency (C1) Outstanding communication skills – written and verbal Self-motivated with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with remote colleagues Excels in a high-volume, fast-paced environment Highly organized, data-driven, and detail-oriented

Experience

5+ years

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
The world’s largest organizations rely on Evident to help them protect their business and brand from third-party risk. Our game-changing technology - which enables the safe and private exchange of proof of insurance, identity, business, and other personal data - helps our customers collect and analyze both individual and business credentials so they can make fast and informed decisions about engaging new third-party partners, prospective employees, franchisees, and more, without compromising their privacy.

In today’s new remote-first, ever-changing regulatory environment, our secure, privacy-first enterprise platform, accessible via web portal or API, provides a highly scalable and configurable solution to manage communications, storage, decisioning, and ongoing monitoring of individual and business credentials.

Evident is a remote-first, VC-backed tech startup, headquartered in Atlanta, GA. Learn more at evidentid.com.

Evident is looking for an ambitious business leader to join the team as an Account Executive (AE). The primary job is to source and drive the full sales cycle of direct customer opportunities. The AE will also collaborate with external GTM and technical partners and internal teams to deliver our solutions to market.

The ideal candidate has full sale-cycle experience for an insuretech/SaaS provider, and has successfully sold into risk management or adjacent buying centers across retail, manufacturing, FIs, property management and construction. 

This role reports to the Head of Sales. Candidates must be based in the US, preferably near a major city to accommodate travel.


What We're Looking For
  • Strong track record of executing against a proven sales process to meet and exceed quota for a SaaS-based service.
  • Passion for prospecting, identifying, and closing new customers, as well as driving sales both directly and through successful partner enablement.
  • Exceptionally strong communication and presentation skills, including the ability to develop content that advances a deal and effectively communicates the value proposition for all stakeholders.
  • Startup experience including identification or emergent market opportunities and proven ability to feedback market requirements into the organization.
  • Self-motivation and autonomy rarely matched by others, while still collaborating, teaching and learning from the team around you.
  • Openness and willingness to be coached and mentored.
  • The ability to thrive in an agile, fast-paced environment.


Qualifications
  • 3+ years of successful software sales experience ideally in the insuretech or risk management space.
  • Experience leveraging G-Suite, SFDC, and SalesLoft to forecast business accurately on a monthly and quarterly basis.
  • Bachelor’s degree required.
  • Proximity near a major city, willingness to travel.
Why Evident?
• Our team solves a crucial problem with huge business potential together, and we are able to see exactly how our contribution affects customers!
• Remote-First work model meaning most employees can work remotely in the US. We have an office in Atlanta, GA for those who prefer an in-office environment.
• Competitive pay package, including base pay and stock options
• Full medical, dental, vision benefits and 401K
• Unlimited PTO
• Paid parental leave to support you and your family
• Annual personal development and technology budget to advance your skills and career
• Weekly stipend for GrubHub home meal delivery, home internet stipend, virtual events, & more!
• Recently named one of Atlanta's Coolest Companies & 50 on Fire by Atlanta Inno
• Recently named one of the Top 10 Fastest Growing Companies in Atlanta & one of the Best Places to Work in Atlanta by Atlanta Business Chronicle

results.title: Senior Account Executive - Enterprise
results.description:
More time is spent on Insight Timer everyday than all other wellbeing and meditation apps. How? Combine 22+ million organic downloads, with the world's largest collection of wellbeing experts and content, plus industry leading app engagement that's 5x stronger than competing platforms.

In 2020 we added Workplace offerings to the platform. Today 65k companies have signed up, and that’s growing by 200 new companies every single day, including most of the Fortune 100, Fortune 1000 and beyond.

We’re now building a Sales team to bring our Premium solutions to the Enterprise. For the accelerating number of companies building Diversity, Equity & Inclusion into the very fabric of their organizations, Insight Timer’s Diversity-first Wellbeing platform is indispensable. Every employee can access world-class wellbeing teachers and content on Insight Timer, no matter their race, culture, sexual orientation, gender, ability, belief system, age or life experience. We’ve been piloting Premium Enterprise solutions with top companies and brands for a little while, and we are now ready to release case studies and testimonials to prove its impact.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Account Executive, with significant experience selling to companies with 5k employees or more. This is a great opportunity to get into a Sales team at its inception, with enormous opportunity for impact; on day 1 you’ll have 65k active leads to select from, each packed with data ready for you to have an insight-driven conversation with top executives at target accounts.

You should be passionate about both Wellbeing and Diversity & Inclusion, with a special skill for sparking that passion in others. You will engage in storytelling to help illustrate concepts and develop trust, be as comfortable in spreadsheets as you are in slides, have a strong business and SaaS acumen, and be able to connect dots top-down and bottom's up.

Given this is a foundational Sales team, we are looking for Sales professionals with strong entrepreneurial spirit. You’ll have a sense of urgency, mission, and be obsessively organized. This is a remote opportunity based in the US-West Coast.

Responsibilities

  • Drive revenue by inspiring senior executives at leading companies to urgently prioritize mental health and wellbeing, for all their people.
  • Successfully negotiate six and seven-figure contracts with C-suite, Senior HR, and Finance executives.
  • Create and execute on top-down & bottom-up account strategies, that enable both sales velocity and total revenue.
  • Be fluid with multi-motion Sales process, by prospecting new potential business independently, whilst leveraging all the benefits of Insight Timer’s PLG motion.
  • Navigate an enterprise to map stakeholders, build champions, generate buy-in and close deals with C-Level decision makers.
  • Serve as an expert to the customer to make informed recommendations about their business, benefits programs, diverse workforce and culture.
  • Instincts to recognize organizational, financial and behavioral structures and obstacles.
  • Impeccable customer skills: communication, compassion, and integrity, whilst finding ways to present Insight Timer’s unique value verbally, in writing, and quantitatively.
  • Coordinate with Insight Timer’s Customer Success team to ensure successful implementations that lead to great adoption and engagement.
  • Strategically manage up-sell / cross-sell opportunities.

About you

  • 8+ years of Sales success driving growth in a SaaS Sales team, with 4+ years of Account Executive experience selling to Enterprise.
  • Track record of over-achieving (top 10-20% of company).
  • Proven ability to prospect with Enterprise customers to maximize revenue growth.
  • Ability to land net new customers, whilst growing Net Dollar Retention by expanding existing customer usage and new product adoption.
  • Experience working with marketing, business, and product teams to find efficient paths to successful and profitable customers.
  • Holds self and others accountable for performance goals.
  • A drive to learn, succeed, and lead by example, adaptable to changing conditions, being comfortable with high levels of ambiguity, and possessing an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Prior Sales methodology training.
  • Bonus: Experience during the scaling of a software or SaaS Sales organization.
  • Bonus: Previous success with selling into HR and Benefits teams is a plus.
  • Bonus: Salesforce/Hubspot and/or Outreach.io proficiency.

Benefits

You’ll be able to share in our success through a generous employee options plan, as well as an uncapped Sales compensation plan.

We have dedicated learning and development budgets to support your growth, as well as a competitive benefits plan.

We’re remote first, with no central office location. We dial in from all over the world, and it’s important that our team is just as diverse as our community of users, customers and teachers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!

results.title: Enterprise MarTech Account Executive
results.description:
Who We Are:

At Munvo, our mission is to enable enterprise organizations to realize the full value of their marketing technology. We are a leading marketing technology consulting firm providing expert consulting services and software solutions. We work with our technology partners Adobe, ActionIQ, Salesforce, SAS, Pega and HCL (Unica) to implement marketing solutions that improve customer experiences and increase customer satisfaction.

Who We’re Looking For:

We are seeking a U.S.-based Enterprise Account Executive to be responsible for selling consulting services and Munvo products to Fortune 500 organizations. The successful candidate will work closely with our US Managing Director, Consulting Managers and Marketing team to position and sell professional marketing services such as:

  • MarTech planning and roadmaps
  • Technology implementations
  • Data architecture design and reviews
  • Marketing operations services
  • Data & analysis services
  • MarTech training
  • Munvo software solutions

 

The Enterprise Account Executive will be supported by a marketing and inside sales team to assist with the generation of contacts and leads. In addition, the position is supported by senior professional services delivery managers for the shaping and presentation of sales proposals.

What You'll Do as an Enterprise Account Executive:

  • Establish, develop, and maintain business relationships with prospects and customers
  • Identify and develop business opportunities in new accounts in the western region
  • Work with strategic partners on co-selling activities to joint accounts
  • Prepare, present and review services proposals to customers
  • Provide transition activities from sales to delivery post sale

Requirements

What You Need to Succeed:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an executive sales role
  • Experience selling consulting services into Fortune 1000 organizations
  • Experience working within MarTech partner ecosystems
  • Excellent communications skills (verbal and written)
  • Experience working in sales tools such as Salesforce.com, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, LeadFeeder, HubSpot, etc.
  • Ability to work autonomously. Munvo’s global workforce is distributed across time zones. Working on MS Teams is the norm, office meetings are not.
  • Willingness to travel on average 2 times per month to meet with prospects and customers.

Benefits

What You’ll Benefit from:

  • Competitive base salary and quarterly bonus based on performance
  • Health insurance package employer contribution
  • Mobile phone plan coverage
  • 4 weeks of annual paid vacation

Why You’ll Love Working at Munvo:

  • Join a growing company that specializes in the rapidly changing marketing technology field
  • When developing proposals to clients, you will enjoy the support of a multi-disciplinary team consisting of software architects, business analysts, software developers, and project managers
  • As a Sales Account Executive you will be able to leverage Munvo’s solid credentials resulting from 300 projects with Fortune 1000 corporations since 2005.

results.title: Sales Operations Associate
results.description:
Powered by People (PBP) is looking for an exceptional Sales Ops Associate to join our growing Sales team. You will focus on communications with our rapidly expanding group of global makers, ensuring they have the information they need in real time to continue selling to buyers across the US and Canada – and soon Europe. On a daily basis you will work with handmade and small batch businesses across five continents managing orders, payments and financing.

You are detail-oriented and flexible problem-solver. This role involves frequent communication with PBP buyers and makers, so the ideal candidate will enjoy communicating with people and working in a social environment. You will manage all sales orders in the PBP platform and ensure their on time confirmation, shipment and delivery. You will utilize a variety of software tools to navigate accounts and create solutions for order issues.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Order Management:

  • Manage Marketplace orders from placement to fulfillment
  • Collaborate with the Merchandising team to support larger transactions
  • Data entry and management related to orders and inventory
  • Support documenting and improving existing Sales Ops processes

Logistics – Work with logistics partners to resolve customs and import issues

Finance Operations –Work with the Finance team to ensure timely payments and payouts

Customer Support – Help resolve Buyer and Maker technical and non-technical issues

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of work experience
  • 1-3 years of customer service, sales or related experience
  • Flexible schedule to accommodate business needs during peak season
  • Experience in website interaction and backend tools is preferred, including Shopify, Zoho, and other CRM tools

Computer & Technical Skills

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, as we currently support through a variety of mediums including phone, email and chat
  • Empathetic to and understanding of our customers’ unique experiences. You are passionate about delighting customers every single day!
  • Ruthlessly organized, disciplined, and comfortable managing competing priorities with care
  • Confident adapting to rapid change in a metrics-based and performance-driven environment
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully multitask. This role involves navigating and diagnosing website experiences while maintaining focus on the customer and their immediate needs.
  • Ability to quickly pick up a variety of software applications with ease

We have found the above qualifications are the most common predictors for a successful Sales Ops Associate at PBP. That said, if your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can rock the role, we’d love to learn more about you.We are a global company with team members in Canada, Kenya, South Africa, India, USA, Turkey, Mexico, Colombia, and The United Kingdom. You can be based anywhere, however, preference will be given to those based in Kenya. You will work closely with team members based in Kenya and interact with Makers working within or close to East African Time.

Benefits

PBP is a social enterprise startup whose mission and values of creativity, responsibility, innovation, diversity, transparency and sustainability are a force for good. Join a passionate global, remote-first team using technology to connect small batch makers and independent brands with buyers and conscious consumers. We provide meaningful, cross-functional and collaborative work, support establishing your home desk, co-working space in our hubs, and opportunities to travel. We are reimagining a world Powered by People. Come join us.
